wikipedia_page.main: Walter Richard Parker VC (20 September 1881 – 28 November 1936) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: *Walter Richard Parker VC (1881–1936), Royal Marine awarded the Victoria Cross at Gallipoli

link_mentions.page: List of English Victoria Cross recipients
response: |Walter Richard Parker || Royal Marines || 1915 || First World War || Gallipoli
* Gallipoli hero Walter Richard Parker, VC, lived in Stapleford and is buried in the town cemetery.
*(1881–1936) Walter Richard Parker of the Royal Marines, awarded the Victoria Cross for valour at Gallipoli in 1915, died at Stapleford.
* Walter Richard Parker (1881–1931), English infantryman, recipient of the Victoria Cross
